intro: Agathosma betulina, commonly known as buchu, is a small shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by small, round fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. Agathosma betulina thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
